name: Luan Vu Hotel

reviews.text: This little hotel is in the perfect backpackers/tourist area of Saigon, they offer free net, breakfast and tourist services. The rooms are not the nicest that I stayed in in Vietnam, but for the low cost and the service, it is well worth it. The people are fantastic and if you arrive on an early bus or train or leave late at night they will accomodate you, let you shower, hang out, check in early or out late for no extra charge. So very helpful.
reviews.title: great location and low price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Luan Vu Guesthouse for 2 nights. The location is great: lots of restaurants, street food stalls and bars around so you can find great places to drink and eat within walking distance at a very good price. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with a fridge, flat screen TV, AC, WiFi, big bed and en suite bathroom. No windows in our room although I think some of the others do have windows. But it didn't really matter since we weren't there during the day. The staff (and especially Cam Thi) were incredibly helpful in getting us orientated around the area, giving us maps, advice, arranging our train tickets and helping us to find the best GBP exchange rate. Would really recommend this place!
reviews.title: Excellent location and very friendly staff!

reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect location, excellent accommodation for the price - definitely coming back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are so friendly and helpful and can organise day trips and bus tickets for you but arent overly pushy like some other places to book their tours.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Location wise it is in the heart of the District 1 and backpackers area, so restaurants and bars and shops on your doorstep and right in the heart of all the action.
reviews.title: Luan Vu is the number one speciality lodging for a reason!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean and friendly hostel! Three flights up with no escalator was a bit of a surprise for our legs, but the room was worth every penny. The staff actually even made us breakfast to go when we woke up a bit late and were right out the door for a day tour to the Mekong Delta.
reviews.title: 2 Nights at Luan Vu - $20 per night and worth every penny!

reviews.text: Luan Vu was in a very central location along what I believe is the backpacker street - we were able to walk around much of the district with no problems both during the day and at night.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, laid back owner

reviews.text: We took 2 rooms for 2 nights the stay was pretty pleasant. The building was tucked in an alley away from the busy main street. Breakfast was basic but we were contented.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked outta the hotel early morning for Cu Chi Tunnels and when we were back during the noon we took our time showering in the bathroom downstairs.
reviews.title: Great value for money. We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In overall the property was well kept, shoes off before you get on the stairs up to the rooms.
reviews.title: Efficient, clean and nice

reviews.text: I was recommended this guest house by the owner of my previous GH in Phnom Penn, as he stays here when visiting HCMC. That was good enough for me. As this was my first visit to HCMC I was excited to find that I was centrally located to everything; in fact I could walk to many sites. Although I only stayed for one night, before moving to their sister guest house around the corner, (which was equally comfortable), I can fully recommend this place.
reviews.title: Position, position, position.
Great location!
reviews.text: I booked here after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.com. The location is fantastic. I was there with a friend, and we basically got a map from the staff and walked through the city. It's very close to most of the places that we wanted to see. There are lots of places to eat around here. And the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a little small, but considering we weren't there to really spend time in the room, it didn't bother us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in all sorts of accomodation throughout india Thailand and Vietnam from backpacker to 5 star accomodation This is by far the best hotel I have stayed for its cost and location and friendliness of the staff, all the posative reviews here a honest and correct, I would have no hestitation to recommending this Hotel to anyone or any age from Backpacker to people used to 4 star accomodation. It was our preferred Hotel in HCMC
reviews.title: What a great Place

reviews.text: I had three nights here and loved it. Kitty and Thao are both very friendly and helpful, and will go out of their way to make sure you find what you need.
reviews.title: Nice quiet place & great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At 20/night, there are plenty of cheaper options in the area, but the aircon is cold, and the rooms are spotlessly clean/quiet so I still think it is good value for money.
reviews.title: Great little hotel, right in heart of city

description: All rooms with LCD screen, cable TV, desk, coffee/tea maker in each room. Luan Vu hotel has room service daily, business center, wifi at lounge and room, airport transfer. With a full range of popular amenities and a friendly, caring staff, it's no wonder guests keep returning to Luan Vu hotel.
